comments.text: Bonm lugar para pegar carona a juiz de fora ou BH. Demorou 10 minutos ou menos

I followed this instructions on november 2013 and got a ride to Juiz de Fora in less than 10 minutes. Got off the bus just after the Fragoso toll, and walked some meters until I found a good spot next to the road. Really easy.
It's easy to get there. The ticket costs 6 R. Lees than 40 min I was there trying.

HOW TO GET HERE:
take a bus from Central do Brasil (Rio de Janeiro) to Vila Canaã (border of Duque de Caxias), and ask to get off it in the toll.
there\\'s a Federal Police next to that toll (the cars go too fast there, anyway i got a ride in less than 20minutes. maybe it\\'ll be easier to you if you take a bus to Petrópolis and start hitchhiking from there. but the bus is like 10reais more expensive -not too much, but you can drink like 3 bottles of beer with the difference hahah-)

VIDEO HITCH
Atualização 2023. Aida um lugar ótimo. Demorei 5 mimutos. Ônibus sai da rodoviaria atrâs da rodoviaria central, plataforma 3. 193C

Pedágio Viúva Graça (toll plaza). Good spot for hitching to São Paulo. You can get here by bus 193C from the bus terminal next to Central Station (metro Central). Starts from platform D, spot no. 07. Hitch slightly further away from toll booths, there is a bus stop to pull over, restaurant and supermarket.
I did take a bus to the EETEPA ( university just across) and  hitchhiked from there. Really easy, most car go to Alter do Chao
Great spot at the gas station, there is signal and you are at the intersection of two roads from where people might go to the east. A 4x4 took us in the back of his car to Jijoca de Jericoacoara.
Perfect spot to go to the north west. There is a gas station on the other side of the road, and a lot of space for trucks to stop.
Plenty of space right after rond point

Perfect spot, near the exit of Matinhos and accessible with the free city bus. In twenty minutes, we had one offer to take us for 80 R$, but we waited a bit more and received a valid hitch all the way to Curitiba! 👌

Next to gas station 
Plenty of food and internet
Long walk to get to this optimum spotNext to posto and lanchonette and place for car to stop
so hard to hitchhike in Brazil but as soon as you start talking to Guayanese folk it was easy enough guayanese in the gas station I marked heading to lethem that we had an easy time getting a ride
A car stopped as soon as we started to hitchike! He took us to a beach to surf, and then to São Paulo.
We first tried to hitchike on the roundabout, but cars had little visibility to see where to stop. It's much better after the bridge when it's a long straight road ahead.
Lots of traffic, and space for cars to stop. Accessible by the city bus 388 from the center of Rio for 5 R$. Our host invited us to do jet ski!!

No se puede cruzar a pie. Un policía muy amable me consiguió una carona con un coche que iba pasando. Las personas tienen mucho miedo de quienes piden carona por el tráfico de drogas de esa zona, así que es mejor que un policía pida la carona por ustedes.
Cheguei aí com uma carona. Todo mondo do Brasilia vai pra Formosa, então é melhor ir pra esse ponto e de aí peguei caona direito pra São Jorge na Chapada dos Veadeiros
Ponto ótimo pra Uberlandia e Brasília. Passei a noite no Limeira num posto (Castelo no se que) e peguei carona até o pedagio.

Ótimo pra São Paulo. Infelizmente eu queria ir pra o Rio de Janeiro. Muitos camioneros pararam pra ofrecer carona ao São Paulo.
Pra o Rio peguei o ônibus e foi pra a 040 mais no sul.

Eu estava precisando de uma carona da praia do rosa para Florianópolis. Nesta curva os carros que passam todos vão em direção a cidade que eu precisava e passam bem devagar pois é uma curva fechada. Tem um bom acostamento para poderem parar e te dar a carona. 

O terceiro carro que passou já parou e me deu carona.
Easy to get to Lancois
12 km to Lencois from there.

We were hitchhiking at the end of the gas station. A car going out of the car station took us directly to Curitiba, but I believe the cars on the rodovia have enough space to stop. The gas station is accessible with the bus 032 from the métro station "Vila Sonia".
Posto Fase Quatro with Shell petrol station. You can get here by bus 164 from Terminal Tietê or from Metro Cidade Jardim, as well as bus 282 from Tietê or Metro Butanta.
Easy to get a ride  to Dianopolis
Roundabout for rides direction Palmas.Dianópolis
Quite easy to get a ride but make sure you go at least to Chapada da Datividade or you’ll get stuck in between cities for a while ;)
There is a speed bump by the gas station  perfect to hitchhike, I found a truck driver all the way to Palmeiras ( Bahia)
Got a ride in 5 min. I was asking people directly at the gas station and got a ride to Maraba
Was hitchhiking with a sign on the road outside of the gas station ( no much traffic at the gas station) and a car drove me alll the way to Altamira ( Para)

Depoia de tentar por mais de três horas debaixo das mangueiras da rotatória anterior, aqui encontrei minha sorte. Uma direra pra BH, comecei a pegar gosta pela Adrnalina, ainda mais depois que começamos a entrar na metropolitana. Nunca tinha visto uma metropolitana tão industrial, tensa e intensa na minha vida. Com tantos morros e desmorros.

Me deixarem ba prf porque pensei que tivesse um quebra-molas. Mas ele parecia bem esbagaçado então não reduzia em nada a velocidade. Não sei hoje. Alternarivas seriam o quebra-molas na saída de Araguari antes da BR e o Posto se Gasolina. Achar alguém indo a Uberlândia ou mesmo Uberaba deve ser bem fácil.

Minha primeira carona notrna, indo pra Araguari a partir de Gyn, Aqui deveria ter um quebra-molas e ou um sensor de velocidade.  Tentei depois da rotatória e não foi muito bom, na saída do posto JK também é possível. Mas se ainda houver um dos dois reguladores de velocidade será bem melhor.  Aqui usei uma plaquinha. Me parou uma mãe com uma filha cantora que tentaria the voice brasil, mas nunca vi, Não sei qual foi o resultado.

Passaria por Catalão algumas outras vezes na minha vida. Quase se

We got there by taxi with the app "Ubiz car Brazil" for 16R$. There are not so many cars but they all go in the right direction and don't go that fast. There is no signal but "bar do limão" might have Wi-Fi.

Trucks are coming out of the quarry regularly. There is a restaurant, Wi-Fi, and a bathroom. The vehicles on the road pass by fast, but you can ask the truck drivers going out of the quarry. Beware of the sun!

We wanted to go to Foz do Iguaçu so it may have been better to hitch at the exit of Guarapuava instead of the entrance. The spot near the roundabout is great because it's after a speed bump on the highway. You can signal to the drivers on the highway, and those who exit the gas station. There is enough space for cars and truck to park for a few minutes.

We got a ride from a truck driver to Foz do Iguaçu! 🚚
We talked with truck drivers while looking for a cardboard. One of them proposed to take us to Guaratuba!
Accessible by bus J62 from Curitiba, a lot of truck drivers stop there as it's the first gas station after Curitiba.
Bus stop to shelter from rain or sun
Perfect spot, place to stop and car have to slow down but very few traffic

Lots of bumper to slow down cars
A motorcycle took me for a long ride 
Happy I’m still alive

State border office
Car have to slow down
Bathrooms available
Posto 24 horas para pernoitar caso não consiga carona, porém com muitos caminhoneiros que param aqui
Easy to get a ride to Porto National with a sign ( 5min )
